info.title: Arrival Naming Service
info.description: Centralized high available service for naming evetyrhing in the Arrival universe

get.summary: Filter set of terms by parameters
get.description: Get localized set of terms by parameters.

parameters.name: Date
parameters.description:
The date and time that the request was originated. The format is defined by [Section 7.1.1.1 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-7.1.1.1).
**NOTE:** That's the only place where we don't use [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for date-time value, just because we can't and have to be compliant with the orthodox HTTP standard.

parameters.name: User-Agent
parameters.description: The identification string of user agent (browser, application, etc). The format is defined by [Section 5.5.3 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.5.3).

parameters.name: X-CorrelationID
parameters.description: Header is used for tracebility between the service that executes this method and AUID generator service. Specifying this header into request client will get the same value into response. All logs inside AUID generator service will contain this header value.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: List of acceptable human languages for response. The format is defined by [Section 5.3.5 of RFC 7231](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7231#section-5.3.5).

parameters.name: X-Touchpoint-Source
parameters.description: Touchpoint source details. Use Base 64 encoding with URL and Filename safe [alphabet](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4648#page-7).

parameters.name: X-Touchpoint-Responsible
parameters.description: Touchpoint responsible person contacts. Use Base 64 encoding with URL and Filename safe [alphabet](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4648#page-7).

Content-Language.description: The [Content-Language](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Content-Language) entity header is used to describe the language(s) intended for the audience, so that it allows a user to differentiate according to the users' own preferred language.

X-CorrelationID.description: Header is used for tracebility between the service that executes this method. Specifying this header into request client will get the same value into response. All logs inside this service will contain this header value.

id.description: The unique ID of the object.

created.description: The high-precision date/time of object's creation specified in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

modified.description: The high-precision date/time of object's last modification in [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) format `YYYY-MM-DD'T'hh:mm:ss.ffffffZ`.

uri.description: The URI of the UI element witch is using a term.

primary.description: The indication whether the contact should be used as default contact of this type.

key.description: Unique key by which the Definition will be available.

synonyms.description: Synonyms terms with the same meaning.

tags.description: Tags by which definitions may be filtered.

Multilingual.title: Multilingual
Multilingual.description: Multilingual set of strings allows to give the same text attribute in multiple languages. Ultimately, it can be given in all human languages known in this Universe. Wherever that's supported by respective object model, its text attribute may be given as a set of values in various locales. For specifying locales we use [IETF language tags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) in the format defined by [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646) (language-TERRITORY). For example, the American English is `en-US`.

mk-MK.description: FYRO Macedonian (Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia)

locale.description: Response locale as [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) in format specified by [RFC 5646](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5646) (language-TERRITORY).

alerts.description: The alerts issued with the response.

element.description: Target element the alert is related to.

path.description: The [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) compliant path specifying certain part of the target object (JSON document) to operate on.

value.description: The value to add, replace or test.

from.description: The [JSON Pointer](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901) compliant path pointing to the location to move/copy from.
